info.name: Cortex Search REST API
info.description:
OpenAPI 3.0 specification for the Cortex Search REST API

Contact Support:
 Name: Snowflake, Inc.
 Email: support@snowflake.com

variable.description: (Required) Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.

(Required) Identifier (i.e. name) for the schema to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases/{database}/schemas` GET request to get a list of available schemas for the specified database.

response.name: successful

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Successfully accepted the request, but it is not completed yet.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Bad Request. The request payload is invalid or malformed. This happens if the application didn't send the correct request payload. The response body may include the error code and message indicating the actual cause. The application must reconstruct the r

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Unauthorized. The request is not authorized. This happens if the attached access token is invalid or missing. The response body may include the error code and message indicating the actual cause, e.g., expired, invalid token. The application must obtain a

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Forbidden. The request is forbidden. This can also happen if the request is made even if the API is not enabled.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Not Found. The request endpoint is not valid. This happens if the API endpoint does not exist, or if the API is not enabled.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Method Not Allowed. The request method doesn't match the supported API. This happens, for example, if the application calls the API with GET method but the endpoint accepts only POST.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Request Timeout. This indicates that the request from the client timed out and was not completed by the server.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Conflict. The requested operation could not be performed due to a conflicting state that could not be resolved. This usually happens when a CREATE request was performed when there is a pre-existing resource with the same name, and also without one of the

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Gone. This error is primarily intended to assist the task of web maintenance by notifying the recipient that the resource is intentionally unavailable.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Limit Exceeded. The number of requests hit the rate limit. The application must slow down the frequency of hitting the API endpoints.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Internal Server Error. The server hit an unrecoverable system error. The response body may include the error code and message for further guidance. The application owner may need to reach out the customer support.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Gateway Timeout. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

query.description:
Query parameter that specifies how to handle the request for a resource that does not exist:
- `true`: The endpoint does not throw an error if the resource does not exist. It returns a 200 success response, but does not take any action on the resource.
- `false`: The endpoint throws an error if the resource doesn't exist.

variable.description: (Required) Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.

(Required) Identifier (i.e. name) for the schema to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases/{database}/schemas` GET request to get a list of available schemas for the specified database.

request.description: Delete a cortex search service with the given name. If ifExists is used, the operation will succeed even if the object does not exist. Otherwise, there will be a failure if the drop is unsuccessful.

response.name: Successful request.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Query parameter that identifies the target to which suspension or resumption of the cortex search service should be applied.

- `false`: The endpoint throws an error if the resource doesn't exist.
Query parameter that identifies the target to which suspension or resumption of the cortex search service should be applied.

response.name: Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

variable.description: (Required) Identifier (i.e. name) for the database to which the resource belongs. You can use the `/api/v2/databases` GET request to get a list of available databases.

Query parameter allowing support for different modes of resource creation. Possible values include:
- `errorIfExists`: Throws an error if you try to create a resource that already exists.
- `orReplace`: Automatically replaces the existing resource with the current one.
- `ifNotExists`: Creates a new resource when an alter is requested for a non-existent resource.
